content: my favorite module of all time is the
labyrinth of madness it was published for second edition Advanced Dungeons &
Dragons and it was intended to be a new tomb of Horrors kind of thing for a new
age fairly light a role-playing and combat but wickedly difficult with
puzzles and traps for some reason room c2 which is called the color of magic
has stuck with me throughout the years so I figured why not build it and walk
you through it so here's the excerpt from the map as taken from the inside
cover the floor of the first portion of the room consists of colored tiles four
unique bespoke situations like this I don't bother with the usual two-by-two
form factor I just build the whole room you can revisit episodes one through
four or my first live stream if you need to refresh on the basic dungeon tile
construction techniques but for sake of completeness I'll just line backer
through the high points the segment is 40 feet long and 20 feet wide so the
foundation needs to be nine and fifteen sixteenths of an inch long and four and
seven eighths of an inch wide cut strips of chipboard that are three quarters of
an inch wide again see the link in the description below for the chipboard that
I use and hot glue them to the three sides that have walls
cut 1/2 inch wide strips of foamboard peel the paper from one side and
texturize with bricks then glue those to the walls now for the spaces themselves
I actually use chipboard again and these will only be one layer thick cut out one
and a quarter inch squares you need 32 of them then paint them red blue and
yellow look at the map excerpt to make the right amount of each after painting
the rest of the tile hot glue the spaces on
let's knock out a quick spell effect for the prismatic wall and Microsoft Word
draw a rectangle and make it one inch tall and seven inches long copy it paste
and move the new one immediately below it touching fill this one black and
change its height to a half-inch another rectangle below again touching for this
one change it to be two inches tall and change the fill to a gradient using the
rainbow preset copy that rectangle below again touching and finally one more
rectangle at the bottom a half inch tall and black print it cut it out and fold
where the colors change in the directions that you see here use glue
stick and a strip of cereal box inside for strength to bring it all together
and another strip of cereal box under the base for strength and stability
lingo prismatic wall spell effect and this one happens to be 30 feet long and
before we go to the table I'd like to take a moment to thank all wcv sponsors
this week I draw your attention to dungeon cast by Dan vicini Dan's designs
are full on custom resin casts he's currently focusing on one and a quarter
inch grid tiles destined for box sets with probable D&D scenarios in them
basically an evening in a box so click the link in the description below and
check out the dungeon cast Facebook page so here's the room set up as the party
sees it upon entering the idea is upon stepping on a colored tile a character
and all their possessions take on that color as if illuminated by a filtered
light if they then step on to another tile they change color again according
to the classic rules for mixing so red stepping on to a blue tile will turn
purple red onto yellow orange yellow onto blue green you get the idea now if
you're a secondary color and you step onto a third tile then you turn a muddy
brown and if you then step on a fourth tile
you turn pitch-black there's many ways the party might address this dexterity
checks jumping pole-vaulting flying wall climbing whatever also a dispel magic
spell will clear a character of all colors gained the module gives all the
technical details so I won't belabor it here so as a character gets to the
eastern area beyond the colored tiles as soon as they step there something will
happen based on whatever color they are some of the effects are okay but most
are pretty bad if they manage to move ten feet beyond the colored grid a
prismatic wall is triggered and suddenly appears at the indicated spot on the map
the spell functions as normal except that a character may ignore the effects
of the color that they currently are as if filtered at the far side a ten
foot length of wall protrudes curiously from the eastern wall this is actually
part of a turnstile a hidden small lever on the right side can be found and
pulling it causes the turnstile to rotate a quarter turn counterclockwise
we represent this with the tiles simply by adding a dead end
the new section protruding into the main room has another lever in the same spot
the original lover is now useless but the new one will cause the turnstile to
rotate again and so on and so on the one that's out in the room is active the
danger is that this turnstile is basically God proof nothing can stop the
rotations short of a wish spell nothing can cause it to go backwards so there
better be at least one party member left in the main room at all times for the
original module the northeast cell contains a feature important for the
adventure but that's where you would insert anything you want if you're just
dropping this room into your own dungeon so I am why lock thank you for joining
me and I'll see you next time
you
